results.byline: By Charlie Savage and Linda Qiu
results.title: Acquittal of Russia Analyst Deals Final Blow to Trump-Era Prosecutor
results.abstract: John H. Durham, the special counsel who investigated the Russia inquiry for more than three years, failed to develop any cases that resulted in convictions.

media.caption: Two F.B.I. agents have testified that Igor Danchenko, who became a paid confidential source, had provided the bureau with valuable information.

results.byline: By Christine Hauser and Michael Levenson
results.title: Jury Convicts Paul Flores of Murdering Kristin Smart in 1996
results.abstract: The California student went missing after Mr. Flores, a fellow student, escorted her to the dorms after an off-campus party. She was never seen again.

media.caption: Paul Flores during his trial in Monterey County Superior Court in Salinas, Calif., in July.

results.title: Elizabeth Holmes Case Takes On More Drama Ahead of Sentencing
results.abstract: Ms. Holmes, founder of the failed blood testing start-up Theranos, asked for a new trial after a surprise visit from a key witness to her house.

media.caption: Elizabeth Holmes arriving with her father, Christian Holmes, left, and her partner, Billy Evans, at the U.S. courthouse in San Jose, Calif., for a hearing in her case on Monday.

results.title: Half the World Has a Clitoris. Why Don’t Doctors Study It?
results.abstract: The organ is “completely ignored by pretty much everyone,” medical experts say, and that omission can be devastating to women’s sexual health.

results.adx_keywords: Consumer Price Index;Inflation (Economics);Food;Income Tax;Tax Credits, Deductions and Exemptions;Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (2017);Taxation;Income;Internal Revenue Service
results.title: Inflation Adjustments Mean Lower Tax Rates for Some in 2023
results.abstract: Filers whose salaries have not kept pace with inflation could see savings on their federal income tax bills.

media.caption: With inflation taking a bite out of paychecks, the Internal Revenue Service will increase the amount of income subject to taxes.

results.title: ‘Still Growing Together,’ a Teenage Crush Leads to Marriage
results.abstract: Brittney Adu was smitten when she saw Aaron Canales on the first day of their freshman year of high school. Despite their cultural differences and the trials of a young romance, their love endured.

media.caption: Brittney Adu said she felt like the “president of the entire world” when Aaron Canales asked her to be his girlfriend in 2013. The couple married Sept. 17 at the Lichterman Nature Center in Memphis.
media.copyright: Whitten Sabbatini for The New York Times

results.title: Four Friends Missing in Oklahoma Found Dismembered, Police Say
results.abstract: A witness had been invited to join the men to “hit a lick big enough for all of them,” or to engage in some kind of criminal behavior, a police chief said on Monday.

media.caption: Joe Prentice, the police chief in Okmulgee, Okla., said investigators believe the missing men had planned to “commit some type of criminal act.”

results.title: ‘You Don’t Look Anorexic’
results.abstract: New research shows that our assumptions about eating disorders are often wrong — and that many larger-bodied people are starving themselves.

media.caption: Sharon Maxwell is recovering from atypical anorexia. She suffered from disordered eating for 19 years before receiving a diagnosis.
media.copyright: Ryan Pfluger for The New York Times

results.title: In Documents Review, Special Master Tells Trump Team to Back Up Privilege Claims
results.abstract: “What’s the expression — ‘Where’s the beef?’ I need some beef,” Judge Raymond Dearie, the independent arbiter, said during a conference call.

results.title: Voters See Democracy in Peril, but Saving It Isn’t a Priority
results.abstract: A New York Times/Siena College poll found that other problems have seized voters’ focus — even as many do not trust this year’s election results and are open to anti-democratic candidates.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Debates (Political);Elections, Governors;Kemp, Brian P;Abrams, Stacey Y;Georgia
results.byline: By Reid J. Epstein and Maya King
results.title: 5 Takeaways From the Georgia Governor’s Debate: Kemp and Abrams Came Ready
results.abstract: The debate between Gov. Brian Kemp and Stacey Abrams produced a substantive hour of policy discussion — and unexpected attention for a little-known Libertarian.

media.caption: Monday’s debate in Atlanta was a demonstration of the political animus that Stacey Abrams, left, and Gov. Brian Kemp, right, have toward each other. A Libertarian candidate, Shane Hazel, made a memorable appearance in the middle.

results.title: Teacher at Center of Hijab Uproar Sues Olympic Medalist for Defamation
results.abstract: After a New Jersey second-grader told her mother that her teacher had tried to pull off her hijab, the story went viral on social media.

media.caption: Ibtihaj Muhammad, an Olympic medalist who fences in a hijab, denounced the teacher’s action as abuse in an Instagram post that went viral.

results.title: Polls Show Hochul’s Lead Dwindling as Zeldin Gains in N.Y. Suburbs
results.abstract: Two polls released on Tuesday showed Gov. Kathy Hochul’s lead narrowing over her Republican challenger, Representative Lee Zeldin, with one poll showing just a four-point lead.

media.caption: Representative Lee Zeldin, left, has attacked Gov. Kathy Hochul on her handling of the state’s economy and crime; she has criticized his stance on abortion and support for Donald J. Trump.
media.copyright: Amir Hamja for The New York Times; Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images

results.byline: By Christine Chung and Christine Hauser
results.title: Storm Brings Taste of Winter to Great Lakes With Snow and Towering Waves
results.abstract: The storm is expected to taper off after blasting Michigan with over a foot of snow in areas and Lake Superior with waves of up to 15 feet.

media.caption: Warnings about frequent and strong wind gusts were in effect through Tuesday for Lake Superior and Lake Michigan, according to the National Weather Service.
